headline: US State Dept approves possible $1.17 billion sale of helicopter equipment to India
summary: The U.S. State Department has approved the potential sale of equipment and follow-on support for MH-60R Seahawk helicopters to India for an estimated cost of $1.17 billion, the Pentagon said on Monday. The principal contractor will be Lockheed Martin, the Pentagon said in a statement.

raw.headline: US State Dept approves possible $1.17 billion sale of helicopter equipment to India
raw.summary: The U.S. State Department has approved the potential sale of equipment and follow-on support for MH-60R Seahawk helicopters to India for an estimated cost of $1.17 billion, the Pentagon said on Monday. The principal contractor will be Lockheed Martin, the Pentagon said in a statement.

headline: RTX Secures a $186M Navy Contract to Support Aegis Weapon System
summary: RTX is set to repair and upgrade 160 parts of the MK99 fire control system and the SPY-1D(V) transmitter, which are two subsystems of the Aegis Weapon System.

raw.headline: RTX Secures a $186M Navy Contract to Support Aegis Weapon System
raw.summary: RTX is set to repair and upgrade 160 parts of the MK99 fire control system and the SPY-1D(V) transmitter, which are two subsystems of the Aegis Weapon System.

headline: LMT Unit Secures $579M Contract to Support Japan's ASEV construction
summary: Lockheed Martin's unit wins a $579-million modification contract to develop, test, and integrate equipment and hardware end items to support the ASEV.

headline: Rocket Lab Secures Contract to Expand Semiconductor Manufacturing
summary: RKLB clinches a $23.9 million award from the U.S. Department of Commerce to enhance its Albuquerque facility's manufacturing capacities.

headline: Arms producers saw revenue up in 2023 with the wars in Ukraine and Gaza, a new report says
summary: STOCKHOLM, Sweden — Major companies in the arms industry saw a 4.2% increase in overall revenue in 2023 with sharp rises for producers based in Russia and the Middle East, a new report said...
